business.headline: Stock market opening: Will Sensex, Nifty rise or fall today?Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs) sold shares worth Rs 525.95 crore, which added pressure on stock prices. This selling by investors was one of the reasons why the market fell slightly on Monday.

Stocks to watch on May 20: BEL, IndusInd Bank, RVNL, BEL, DLFMarkets ended lower in the last session. This decline came after global markets reacted to Moody's decision to lower the credit rating of the United States. However, mid-cap and small-cap stocks continued to do wel.

Two foreign funds with investment in Adani Group under Sebi scannerThe Adani Group and its 13 offshore investors have been facing an investigation by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) since Hindenburg Research in 2023 alleged improper use of tax havens by the group, triggering a stock sell-off.

Six IndusInd Bank officials under Sebi scanner for insider trading: ReportThe Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) is checking the timing of these trades to find out whether the share sales broke Sebi's rules or the bank's own internal code of conduct.

Byju's Raveendran promises comeback despite big setbacks: 'I am not giving up'Byju Raveendran, the founder of the edtech company, Byju's, admitted that the company made some business mistakes during its rapid global expansion.

'Boycott Turkey' hits fashion: Myntra, Ajio stop selling these Turkish labelsThe two leading online fashion platforms have removed Turkish products after growing boycott calls over Turkey's support to Pakistan during the recent India-Pakistan military conflict.
Sensex closes 271 points lower, Nifty below 25,000, Eternal falls 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 271.17 points to end at 82,059.42, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 74.35 points to close at 24,945.45.

'High salaries may not last forever': Zoho's Sridhar Vembu warns software engineersSridhar Vembu explained that the upcoming changes in software development, especially with large language models (LLMs) and new tools powered by artificial intelligence (AI), might lead to many software jobs being lost.
Vodafone Idea shares drop 10%. Here's whyVodafone Idea share price: Over the last month, Vodafone Idea's stock has gone down by 16.73%. In the last year, it has fallen over 50%.

What's new in ITR Forms for FY 2024-25? 5 key changes you must knowNow taxpayers need to clearly mention the specific TDS section under which tax was deducted from your income. This change applies to ITR forms 1, 2, 3 and 5.

Supreme Court dismisses Vodafone Idea, Airtel plea on AGR interest duesThe court dismissed the writ petitions filed by the telecom operators, calling the move "shocking" and stating that the petitions were "misconceived."

Brent crude slips below $65: These stocks may benefit investorsBrent futures for July delivery were trading at $64.98 a barrel, down 0.66%. This is a steep fall from January, when prices were above $80 a barrel.

entertainment.headline: Rajamouli recommends Tourist Family after a glowing review. Director reactsDirector SS Rajamouli showered appreciation on the Tamil film, 'Tourist Family', starring Sasikumar and Simran. Debutant director Abishan Jeevinth was over the moon after the 'RRR' director called his film the best cinematic experience of the year.

Tamil actors Vishal, Sai Dhanshika announce wedding in AugustTamil actors Vishal and Sai Dhanshika made their relationship official at 'Yogi Da' event in Chennai on Monday. The two will get married in August.

'Sesame Street' heads to Netflix while staying on PBSSesame Street will stream new and classic episodes on Netflix later this year, while continuing its run on PBS. Season 56 will feature shorter, story-driven episodes and fresh visual updates.

Billie Eilish Tour 2025: New dates, Austin concerts, and ticket infoBillie Eilish has added 23 new shows to her 2025 tour, including Austin, Texas. The expanded tour spans Japan and the US, and tickets will be available from May 22.

'Dilbert' creator Scott Adams diagnosed with same prostate cancer as Joe Biden"Dilbert" creator Scott Adams announced he has advanced prostate cancer, similar to Joe Biden's. He expects to live only a few more months and continues updating fans despite constant pain.

Dawn Richard testifies Diddy threatened her after witnessing Cassie attackDawn Richard testified that Diddy threatened her after she saw him abuse Cassie. Cassie's ex-roommate also detailed alleged assaults, NDAs, and financial control in the ongoing federal trial.

Rajinikanth to team up with director Vivek Athreya for his next: ReportTelugu director Vivek Athreya, known for 'Brochevarevarura' and 'Saripodhaa Sanivaaram,' is reportedly in talks with Superstar Rajinikanth for his next film, likely to be produced by Mythri Movie Makers.

Bigg Boss fame Shilpa Shirodkar tests Covid-19 positive, urges fans to 'wear masks'Former Bigg Boss 18 contestant Shilpa Shirodkar has tested Covid-19 positive. She has urged her fans to follow adequate precautions.

Naseeruddin Shah recalls working '3 shifts a day' just for money: No worse tortureNaseeruddin Shah spoke about the struggles of doing multiple film shifts just for money and called it a painful experience. His wife, Ratna Pathak Shah, shared how she always gives her best, even in small roles, and admired Naseeruddin's deep dedication to his art.

SRK takes train ride from Delhi-Kolkata in rare photos shared by old friendActor Amar Talwar shared rare old photos of Shah Rukh Khan from their theatre days, showing the superstar during a train journey with friends before fame.

Ishaan-Bhumi's chemistry to Zeenat's cameo, The Royals director reacts to criticism'The Royals' director Priyanka Ghose responds to mixed reactions to the show's lead chemistry and cameo roles. She remains focused on her work while fans await news of a second season.

Twinkle Khanna's lesson to Pakistan: Let Dhinchak Pooja re-dub Abida Parveen songsTwinkle Khanna reacted to Pakistani actors getting removed from posters of Bollywood songs. The actor-author suggested that Abida Parveen's songs get re-dubbed by Dhinchak Pooja.

Dhanush meets Tourist Family director Abishan Jeevinth, says he knew it would workDebutant director Abishan Jeevinth has been receiving a lot of appreciation for his film 'Tourist Family', starring Sasikumar and Simran. The latest to join the list is 'Raayan' actor Dhanush.

Nimrat Kaur on fewer work opportunities in films: People thought I moved to USActor Nimrat Kaur reveals how industry assumptions about her moving abroad affected her career opportunities. She discusses her preference for quality roles and interest in exploring new genres like horror and action.

No new films in Andhra, Telangana as exhibitors announce theatre strike from June 1Cinema exhibitors in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana have announced an indefinite shutdown of theatres from June 1, 2025. If the shutdown goes ahead, big June releases, including 'Hari Hara Veera Mallu' and 'Thug Life,' may be affected.

Sharmila Tagore in Cannes with daughter Saba ahead of Aranyer Din Ratri screeningVeteran actor Sharmila Tagore and daughter Saba Pataudi arrived at the 2025 Cannes Film Festival for the screening of Satyajit Ray's restored classic 'Aranyer Din Ratri'. The film, that will be showcased in the Cannes Classics section, highlights Ray's timeless storytelling and features an ensemble cast including Tagore, Simi Garewal, and Soumitra Chatterjee.

BTS Jin urges fans not to grab his hand after kiss controversy at BTS FestaDuring the fan event Hi-Seokjin, BTS member Jin asked ARMY not to grab his hand. He also set a condition for when fans should avoid taking pictures.

Suniel Shetty is missing not being part of Border 2: But my son Ahan is thereSuniel Shetty, who was part of the 1997 film 'Border,' talks about its sequel and his son Ahan Shetty being part of it. He also praises Varun Dhawan for taking care of his son on the set.

Adarsh Gourav and Shanaya Kapoor to begin Tu Yaa Main shooting in June. DetailsAdarsh Gourav and Shanaya Kapoor are set to begin shooting for their upcoming thriller 'Tu Yaa Main' in June. Directed by Bejoy Nambiar and produced by Aanand L Rai, the film will release on Valentine's Day 2026.

general news.headline: Top Army officer says India can strike all of Pak: They'll need deep hole to hideThe entire territory of Pakistan is within India's strike range, and if the Pakistani Army relocates its headquarters, it would need to find a very deep hole to hide, a top Indian Army officer underscored India's military prowess.

Bengaluru rain: Elderly man, 12-year-old boy electrocuted in flooded apartmentFollowing heavy rains in Bengaluru, two people died in the BTM Layout area while trying to clear waterlogging in their apartment complex. A 35-year-old woman died in Whitefield after a compound wall collapsed.

From Vaisakhi in Pak to espionage: How Jyoti Malhotra became a security threatJyoti Malhotra, the Haryana-based YouTuber arrested on charges of espionage, first visited Pakistan in 2023 during the 324th Vaisakhi Festival. Her trip has come under the scanner by Indian intel agencies for allegedly aiding cross-border influence operations.

News Menu, May 20: Waqf Act in top court; Beating Retreat at Wagah resumes todayWaqf Act hearing in the Supreme Court today. Donald Trump says a Russia-Ukraine ceasefire is imminent. The political fight over Operation Sindoor continues. Beating Retreat at ceremony the Wagah border resumes today. Check out what else is on the rich menu of India Today's news today.

How India will bypass Bangladesh roads and roadblocksAfter Bangladeshi interim leader Muhammad Yunus referred to India's "landlocked" Northeast during a China visit, New Delhi responded by restricting Bangladeshi exports and fast-tracking alternative connectivity plans for the Northeast, bypassing Bangladesh. The key to that is the Kaladan Multi-Modal Transit Project, which will link Kolkata with Mizoram via Myanmar.

Russia, Ukraine to immediately start ceasefire talks: Trump after call with PutinUS President Donald Trump said that Russia and Ukraine will immediately start talks on a ceasefire. He said that around 5,000 soldiers are killed every week in the Russia-Ukraine conflict.

Mumbai woman looked on as lover raped, killed her 2-year-old daughter: CopsThe minor girl was raped by Farhan Shaikh in front of her mother, Reena Shaikh, in Mumbai's Malvani area. Both the accused are currently in police custody.
No parking space, no car: Maharashtra's new policy to tackle congestionMaharashtra transport minister Pratab Sarnaik announced that proof of parking space will now be mandatory for car registration.

MS Dhoni vs Vaibhav Suryavanshi: New Delhi set for IPL's oldest vs youngestIPL 2025: MS Dhoni is set to play what could be one of his final IPL matches in New Delhi as CSK face RR in a dead-rubber clash. The spotlight also shines on 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi, who will take on the CSK captain in a rare oldest-vs-youngest IPL showdown.
An Architectural Trail in GujaratPress Release | Vadnagar has substantial remains of its ancient Buddhist heritage.

Better safe than sorry: High Court after Turkish firm Celebi's clearance revokedIndia revoked the security clearance of Turkish-based firm Celebi Aviation in the interest of "national security" after Ankara sided with Pakistan and condemned India's strikes on the neighbouring country.

Hand over Hafiz Saeed, things will be over: Indian diplomat's message to PakIndia's envoy to Israel says Operation Sindoor is paused, not over. He urges Pakistan to extradite 26/11 terrorists and warns that cross-border terror will be met with continued offensive action.

American Manhunt review: Riveting documentary about hunt for Laden that hits homeReleased-Wed May 14, 2025The timing of the release of 'American Manhunt - Osama bin Laden' on Netflix India may be coincidental. However, that's what exactly makes it feel so personal. The three-part documentary humanises the entire operation - the facts we know, the minds we don't.

How Pakistan rhetoric threatens nuclear non-attack pact with IndiaThe 1988 pact mandates India-Pakistan to desist from attacking each other's nuclear facilities and is one of the few confidence-building measures surviving decades of conflict

Who are bigger sharks: Vice President on delay in FIR in Justice Varma cash rowVice President Jagdeep Dhankhar questioned the delay in the lodging of an FIR in the cash discovery case involving High Court judge Justice Yashwant Varma and said "who are the bigger sharks".

Trump alleges cover-up in Biden's cancer diagnosis, says public was misledTrump questioned the timing of Biden's cancer disclosure, suggesting a cover-up. Biden revealed an aggressive prostate cancer diagnosis with a Gleason score of 9. Health transparency reemerges as a political flashpoint.

Tamil actors Vishal, Sai Dhanshika announce wedding in AugustTamil actors Vishal and Sai Dhanshika made their relationship official at 'Yogi Da' event in Chennai on Monday. The two will get married in August.

Youtuber Manish Kashyap locked in room, beaten up by junior doctors in Patna The BJP leader and Youtuber allegedly got into a dispute with a female junior doctor, leading to an escalated response by the junior doctors.

America had no role in working out cessation of hostilities, MPs panel toldForeign Secretary Vikram Misri told a parliamentary panel that the India-Pakistan ceasefire was strictly bilateral, dismissing US involvement and denying any nuclear signalling from Islamabad.

SunRisers burst LSG's bubble, leave Pant's playoff dreams in tattersRishabh Pant's Lucknow Super Giants were knocked out of the IPL 2025 after a terrible show against SunRisers Hyderabad on Monday, May 19. Abhishek Sharma and Eshan Malinga combined to hand LSG a 6-wicket defeat at the Ekana Stadium in Lucknow.

Indian-origin professor in UK loses OCI status over anti-India activitiesThe OCI status of UK-based Indian-origin academician Nitasha Kaul has been cancelled over "anti-India activities", driven by "malice and complete disregard for facts or history". The government notice was shared by Kaul, who was deported from Bengaluru airport last year within hours of her landing in India.

US moves to block visas for Indian travel agents involved in illegal immigrationThe US has imposed visa restrictions on Indian travel agency leaders accused of aiding illegal immigration, as part of a broader crackdown targeting human smuggling networks, according to the State Department.

Signals of strength: Meet woman officer who played backbone role during Op SindoorThe woman officer from the Signals regiment recalled her experiences from the conflict, during which she and her team handled communication amongst various branches of the army, not only on the ground, but also in the air.

From Jyoti Malhotra to Devender Singh: 11 'Pak spies' caught in India over 3 daysA YouTuber, security guard and an app developer were among the 11 people caught red-handed by the police for allegedly passing on sensitive information about India's national security and military to Pakistani operatives.

sports.headline: Retain fully fit players next time: Kaif's scathing verdict on LSGFormer cricketer Mohammad Kaif has criticised LSG's team-building strategy, urging the franchise to prioritise fitness over star power after their IPL 2025 playoff exit. Injuries to key bowlers like Mayank Yadav and Mohsin Khan played a major role in the team's poor second-half showing.

MS Dhoni vs Vaibhav Suryavanshi: New Delhi set for IPL's oldest vs youngestIPL 2025: MS Dhoni is set to play what could be one of his final IPL matches in New Delhi as CSK face RR in a dead-rubber clash. The spotlight also shines on 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi, who will take on the CSK captain in a rare oldest-vs-youngest IPL showdown.

Nightmares end: Pant should have faith despite poor IPL, says ChopraFormer cricketer Aakash Chopra has urged Rishabh Pant to have faith in what is turning out to be a difficult patch in his career. Pant is not only out of the ODI team, but has fallen into a terrible spiral in the IPL 2025 as well.

UAE chase record 206 in Sharjah, beat Bangladesh for first time in T20I cricketUAE vs Bangladesh, 2nd T20I: The UAE pulled off their highest-ever T20I chase to beat Bangladesh for the first time in T20I cricket. Captain Muhammad Waseem led from the front with a blistering 82 in Sharjah.

Rishabh Pant blames unsettled bowling unit after early exit from IPL 2025Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) captain Rishabh Pant has blamed the team's unsettled bowling unit following their early exit from the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025). LSG got out of the playoffs race after a six-wicket loss against Sunrisers Hyderabad.

SunRisers burst LSG's bubble, leave Pant's playoff dreams in tattersRishabh Pant's Lucknow Super Giants were knocked out of the IPL 2025 after a terrible show against SunRisers Hyderabad on Monday, May 19. Abhishek Sharma and Eshan Malinga combined to hand LSG a 6-wicket defeat at the Ekana Stadium in Lucknow.

Out of form Rishabh Pant must play on instinct and not to prove a point: Aaron FinchFormer Australia cricketer Aaron Finch has said that Rishabh Pant has looked completely out of rhythm in the ongoing Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) and advised him to play on instincts instead of proving a point.

Watch: Abhishek Sharma loses cool after Digvesh Rathi's signature send-offIPL 2025, LSG vs SRH: SunRisers Hyderabad opener Abhishek Sharma was involved in a tense face-off with Digvesh Rathi after the Lucknow Super Giants spinner gave him a send-off in his trademark style.

Disappointed Pooran ready to lead LSG's charge after much-needed breakNicholas Pooran said that he was ready to lead Lucknow Super Giants' charge after a much-needed IPL break. The team aims to regain momentum and secure a playoffs spot despite recent setbacks.

Harshal Patel faster than Lasith Malinga to take 150 wickets in IPL historyIndia and Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) seamer Harhsal Patel became the fastest bowler to take 150 wickets in IPL history as he left Lasith Malinga and Yuzvendra Chahal behind in the list.

LSG vs SRH: Eshan Malinga's stunning catch compounds Rishabh Pant's horror showIPL 2025: Rishabh Pant was dismissed for 7 in Lucknow Super Giant's match against SunRisers Hyderabad in Lucknow. Eshan Malinga took a stunning return catch to add to Pant's woes on Monday, May 19.

Out of form Rishabh Pant must play on instinct and not to prove a point: Aaron FinchFormer Australia cricketer Aaron Finch has said that Rishabh Pant has looked completely out of rhythm in the ongoing Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) and advised him to play on instincts instead of proving a point.

Watch: Abhishek Sharma loses cool after Digvesh Rathi's signature send-offIPL 2025, LSG vs SRH: SunRisers Hyderabad opener Abhishek Sharma was involved in a tense face-off with Digvesh Rathi after the Lucknow Super Giants spinner gave him a send-off in his trademark style.

Disappointed Pooran ready to lead LSG's charge after much-needed breakNicholas Pooran said that he was ready to lead Lucknow Super Giants' charge after a much-needed IPL break. The team aims to regain momentum and secure a playoffs spot despite recent setbacks.

Harshal Patel faster than Lasith Malinga to take 150 wickets in IPL historyIndia and Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) seamer Harhsal Patel became the fastest bowler to take 150 wickets in IPL history as he left Lasith Malinga and Yuzvendra Chahal behind in the list.

LSG vs SRH: Eshan Malinga's stunning catch compounds Rishabh Pant's horror showIPL 2025: Rishabh Pant was dismissed for 7 in Lucknow Super Giant's match against SunRisers Hyderabad in Lucknow. Eshan Malinga took a stunning return catch to add to Pant's woes on Monday, May 19.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
